remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供支持的属性和方法中定义以及其他属性和方法，使用户直接通过 HTTP 与服务器交互。The class provides support for the properties and methods defined in and for additional properties and methods that enable the user to interact directly with servers using HTTP. 不要使用构造函数。Do not use the constructor. 使用方法初始化新对象。Use the method to initialize new objects. 如果方案的统一资源标识符 (URI) 是`http://`或`https://`，返回对象。If the scheme for the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) is `http://` or `https://`, returns an object. 方法中指定的资源发出同步请求属性，并返回包含响应对象。The method makes a synchronous request to the resource specified in the property and returns an that contains the response object. 可以使用返回的流接收的响应数据。The response data can be received by using the stream returned by . 如果关闭响应对象或响应流时，剩余数据将作废。If the response object or the response stream is closed, remaining data will be forfeited. 将耗尽剩余的数据并关闭流的响应对象，如果以下条件成立时，将为后续请求重新使用套接字： 它是保持活动状态或通过管线传输请求，只有少量的数据需要接收，或在较短时间间隔内收到剩余数据。The remaining data will be drained and the socket will be re-used for subsequent requests when closing the response object or stream if the following conditions hold: it's a keep-alive or pipelined request, only a small amount of data needs to be received, or the remaining data is received in a small time interval. 如果没有提到条件保存或超出消耗时间，将关闭套接字。If none of the mentioned conditions hold or the drain time is exceeded, the socket will be closed. 为保持活动状态或通过管道传递的连接，我们强烈建议在应用程序直到 EOF 读取流。For keep-alive or pipelined connections, we strongly recommend that the application reads the streams until EOF. 这可确保将生成更好的性能和更低的使用的资源的后续请求重复使用套接字。This ensures that the socket will be re-used for subsequent requests resulting in better performance and less resources used. 如果想要将数据发送到的资源方法将返回对象，用于将数据发送。When you want to send data to the resource, the method returns a object to use to send data. 和方法提供对发送数据流的异步访问。The and methods provide asynchronous access to the send data stream. 客户端身份验证与，客户端证书必须安装在我的当前用户的证书存储。For client authentication with , the client certificate must be installed in the My certificate store of the current user. 类将引发访问资源时出现错误时。The class throws a when errors occur while accessing a resource. 属性包含值，该值指示错误的源。The property contains a value that indicates the source of the error. 当是，则属性包含从资源接收。When is , the property contains the received from the resource. 公开常见 HTTP 标头值作为属性发送到 Internet 资源，由方法，或设置由系统;下表包含的完整列表。 exposes common HTTP header values sent to the Internet resource as properties, set by methods, or set by the system; the following table contains a complete list. 您可以在设置其他标头属性作为名称/值对。You can set other headers in the property as name/value pairs. 请注意服务器和缓存可能会更改或在请求过程中添加标头。Note that servers and caches may change or add headers during the request. 下表列出了通过属性或方法或系统设置的 HTTP 标头。The following table lists the HTTP headers that are set either by properties or methods or the system. |HeaderHeader|通过设置Set by| |------------|------------| |接受Accept|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |连接Connection|通过设置属性，属性。Set by the property, property.| |内容长度Content-Length|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |Content-TypeContent-Type|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |期望Expect|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |日期Date|设置当前日期到系统。Set by the system to current date.| |HostHost|设置为当前主机信息系统。Set by the system to current host information.| |如果-修改-自If-Modified-Since|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |范围Range|通过设置方法。Set by the method.| |引用站点Referer|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |传输编码Transfer-Encoding|通过设置属性 (属性必须为`true`)。Set by the property (the property must be `true`).| |用户代理User-Agent|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| > [!NOTE] > 已自动注册。 is registered automatically. 不需要调用方法来注册之前使用 Uri 开头`http://`或`https://`。You do not need to call the method to register before using URIs beginning with `http://` or `https://`. 在本地计算机或应用程序配置文件可以指定使用默认代理。The local computer or application config file may specify that a default proxy be used. 如果指定属性，然后从的代理设置属性重写在本地计算机或应用程序配置文件和实例将使用指定的代理设置。If the property is specified, then the proxy settings from the property override the local computer or application config file and the instance will use the proxy settings specified. 如果未指定代理配置文件中，属性未指定，类使用继承自 Internet 资源管理器在本地计算机上的代理设置。If no proxy is specified in a config file and the property is unspecified, the class uses the proxy settings inherited from Internet Explorer on the local computer. 如果没有在 Internet Explorer 代理设置，该请求是直接发送到服务器。If there are no proxy settings in Internet Explorer, the request is sent directly to the server. 类继承自 Internet 资源管理器以不同的方式不是直接通过 Internet Explorer 分析跳过列表的通配符字符与分析代理跳过列表。The class parses a proxy bypass list with wildcard characters inherited from Internet Explorer differently than the bypass list is parsed directly by Internet Explorer. 例如，类分析的正则表达式的"nt \*"从 Internet 资源管理器的跳过列表"nt。 $"。For example, the class will parse a bypass list of "nt\*" from Internet Explorer as a regular expression of "nt.$". 这不同于 Internet Explorer 的本机行为。This differs from the native behavior of Internet Explorer. 因此的 URL"`http://intxxxxx`"将绕过代理帐户使用类，但将不使用 Internet Explorer 使用代理。So a URL of "`http://intxxxxx`" would bypass the proxy using the class, but would not bypass the proxy using Internet Explorer. > [!NOTE] > 框架缓存 SSL 会话，因为它们创建并尝试再次使用的会话缓存适用于新的请求，在可能的情况。The Framework caches SSL sessions as they are created and attempts to reuse a cached session for a new request, if possible. 在尝试以重复使用的 SSL 会话时，框架将使用的第一个元素（如果没有一个），或尝试重复使用匿名会话，如果为空。When attempting to reuse an SSL session, the Framework uses the first element of (if there is one), or tries to reuse an anonymous sessions if is empty. > [!NOTE] > 出于安全原因，默认情况下禁用了 cookie。For security reasons, cookies are disabled by default. 如果你想要使用 cookie，则使用属性，以便启用 cookie。If you want to use cookies, use the property to enable cookies. .NET Framework 4.6 包括一个新的安全功能，将阻止不安全的密码和哈希算法的连接。The .NET Framework 4.6 includes a new security feature that blocks insecure cipher and hashing algorithms for connections. 默认情况下，使用 TLS/SSL 通过 HttpClient、 HttpWebRequest、 FTPClient，SmtpClient、 SslStream 等 Api 和面向.NET Framework 4.6 的应用程序获得更安全的行为。Applications using TLS/SSL through APIs such as HttpClient, HttpWebRequest, FTPClient, SmtpClient, SslStream, etc. and targeting .NET Framework 4.6 get the more-secure behavior by default. 开发人员可能想要选择退出此行为以便保持与带 RC4 服务及其现有 SSL3 服务或 TLS 互操作性。Developers may want to opt out of this behavior in order to maintain interoperability with their existing SSL3 services OR TLS w/ RC4 services. [这篇文章](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3069494)介绍了如何修改你的代码，以便禁用新行为。[This article](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3069494) explains how to modify your code so that the new behavior is disabled. ## Examples 下面的代码示例将创建uri http://www.contoso.com/。The following code example creates an for the URI http://www.contoso.com/. [!code-cpp[Classic HttpWebRequest Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic HttpWebRequest Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic HttpWebRequest Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic HttpWebRequest Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpWebRequest Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic HttpWebRequest Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法取消对资源的请求。The method cancels a request to a resource. 取消请求后，调用， ， ， ， ，或方法使与属性设置为。After a request is canceled, calling the , , , , , or method causes a with the property set to . 方法以同步方式执行对指定的回调或方法如果未完成这些操作时调用方法。The method will synchronously execute the callback specified to the or methods if the method is called while either of these operations are outstanding. 这可能导致潜在的死锁问题。This can lead to potential deadlock issues. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[网络跟踪](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e993b7c3-087f-45d8-9c02-9dded936d804)。For more information, see [Network Tracing](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e993b7c3-087f-45d8-9c02-9dded936d804). ## Examples 对于异步请求，它是客户端应用程序来实现其自己的超时机制的责任。In the case of asynchronous requests, it is the responsibility of the client application to implement its own time-out mechanism. 下面的代码示例演示如何执行此操作。The following code example shows how to do this. summary.span: Adds a range header to the request.

span.span: Adds a range header to the request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 由于 HTTP 的所有实体都都包含在 HTTP 消息作为字节序列，是对 HTTP 的任何实体有意义的字节范围概念。Since all HTTP entities are represented in HTTP messages as sequences of bytes, the concept of a byte range is meaningful for any HTTP entity. 但是，并非所有客户端和服务器必须支持字节范围操作。However, not all clients and servers need to support byte-range operations. 请求的范围标头允许客户端请求它仅想要接收的字节指定范围的某些部分中的 HTTP 实体。The Range header on a request allows a client to request that it only wants to receive some part of the specified range of bytes in an HTTP entity. 服务器不需要支持范围标头请求。Servers are not required to support Range header requests.

span.span: Adds a byte range header to a request for a specific range from the beginning or end of the requested data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将字节范围标头添加到请求。The method adds a byte range header to the request. 如果`range`是正数，`range`参数指定的范围的起始点。If `range` is positive, the `range` parameter specifies the starting point of the range. 服务器应开始发送数据从`range`参数指定到末尾的 HTTP 实体中的数据。The server should start sending data from the `range` parameter specified to the end of the data in the HTTP entity. 如果`range`为负，`range`参数指定的范围的结束点。If `range` is negative, the `range` parameter specifies the ending point of the range. 服务器应该开始将数据发送到 HTTP 实体中的数据开始从`range`指定的参数。The server should start sending data from the start of the data in the HTTP entity to the `range` parameter specified. 由于 HTTP 的所有实体都都包含在 HTTP 消息作为字节序列，是对 HTTP 的任何实体有意义的字节范围概念。Since all HTTP entities are represented in HTTP messages as sequences of bytes, the concept of a byte range is meaningful for any HTTP entity. 但是，并非所有客户端和服务器必须支持字节范围操作。However, not all clients and servers need to support byte-range operations. 请求的范围标头允许客户端请求它仅想要接收的字节指定范围的某些部分中的 HTTP 实体。The Range header on a request allows a client to request that it only wants to receive some part of the specified range of bytes in an HTTP entity. 服务器不需要支持范围标头请求。Servers are not required to support Range header requests. 在请求服务器发送前 100 个字节 （从开头到字节位置 99） 将如下所示的 HTTP 协议请求中的范围标头的示例：An example of a Range header in an HTTP protocol request that requests the server send the first 100 bytes (from the start to byte position 99) would be the following: `Range: bytes=0-99\r\n\r\n` 此示例中，为`range`参数应为-99 之间。For this example, the `range` parameter would be -99. HTTP 服务器指示支持的范围标头与 Accept-ranges 标头。A HTTP server indicates support for Range headers with the Accept-Ranges header. 支持字节范围的服务器的 Accept-ranges 标头的示例将如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that supports byte-ranges would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: bytes\r\n\r\n` Accept-ranges 标头未收到来自服务器的响应的标头中，如果服务器不支持范围标头。If an Accept-Ranges header is not received in the header of the response from the server, then the server does not support Range headers. 从服务器不支持范围，但可以识别 Accept-ranges 标头，Accept-ranges 标头的示例将如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that does not support ranges, but recognizes the Accept-Ranges header, would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: none\r\n\r\n` 从接收时响应范围请求，分析和可通过上的属性仅与整个请求相关联的 HTTP 标头类。When receiving the response from a range request, only the HTTP headers associated with the entire request are parsed and made available via properties on the class. 在响应中返回与每个范围关联的标题。Headers associated with each range are returned in the response. ## Examples 下面的代码示例将添加到请求的范围标头。The following code example adds a range header to the request. [!code-cpp[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange/cpp/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange/cs/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange/vb/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将字节范围标头添加到请求。The method adds a byte range header to the request. 由于 HTTP 的所有实体都都包含在 HTTP 消息作为字节序列，是对 HTTP 的任何实体有意义的字节范围概念。Since all HTTP entities are represented in HTTP messages as sequences of bytes, the concept of a byte range is meaningful for any HTTP entity. 但是，并非所有客户端和服务器必须支持字节范围操作。However, not all clients and servers need to support byte-range operations. 请求的范围标头允许客户端请求它仅想要接收的字节指定范围的某些部分中的 HTTP 实体。The Range header on a request allows a client to request that it only wants to receive some part of the specified range of bytes in an HTTP entity. 服务器不需要支持范围标头请求。Servers are not required to support Range header requests. 请求前 100 个字节会通过 HTTP 协议请求中的范围标头的示例应如下所示：An example of a Range header in an HTTP protocol request that requests the first 100 bytes would be would be the following: `Range: bytes=0-99\r\n\r\n` 对于本例，请`from`参数将被指定为 0 和`to`参数会被指定为 99。For this example, the `from` parameter would be specified as 0 and the `to` parameter would be specified as 99. 范围说明符将自动设置为"bytes"中，此方法。The range specifier is automatically set as "bytes" by this method. HTTP 服务器指示支持的范围标头与 Accept-ranges 标头。A HTTP server indicates support for Range headers with the Accept-Ranges header. 支持字节范围的服务器的 Accept-ranges 标头的示例将如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that supports byte-ranges would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: bytes\r\n\r\n` Accept-ranges 标头未收到来自服务器的响应的标头中，如果服务器不支持范围标头。If an Accept-Ranges header is not received in the header of the response from the server, then the server does not support Range headers. 从服务器不支持范围，但可以识别 Accept-ranges 标头，Accept-ranges 标头的示例将如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that does not support ranges, but recognizes the Accept-Ranges header, would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: none\r\n\r\n` 从接收时响应范围请求，分析和可通过上的属性仅与整个请求相关联的 HTTP 标头类。When receiving the response from a range request, only the HTTP headers associated with the entire request are parsed and made available via properties on the class. 在响应中返回与每个范围关联的标题。Headers associated with each range are returned in the response. ## Examples 下面的代码示例将添加到请求的范围标头。The following code example adds a range header to the request. [!code-cpp[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange2/cpp/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange2/cs/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange2/vb/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: Adds a Range header to a request for a specific range from the beginning or end of the requested data.

span.span: Adds a Range header to a request for a specific range from the beginning or end of the requested data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法向请求添加范围标头。The method adds a Range header to the request. 如果`range`是正数，`range`参数指定的范围的起始点。If `range` is positive, the `range` parameter specifies the starting point of the range. 服务器应开始发送数据从`range`参数指定到末尾的 HTTP 实体中的数据。The server should start sending data from the `range` parameter specified to the end of the data in the HTTP entity. 如果`range`为负，`range`参数指定的范围的结束点。If `range` is negative, the `range` parameter specifies the ending point of the range. 服务器应该开始将数据发送到 HTTP 实体中的数据开始从`range`指定的参数。The server should start sending data from the start of the data in the HTTP entity to the `range` parameter specified. 由于 HTTP 的所有实体都都包含在 HTTP 消息作为字节序列，是对 HTTP 的任何实体有意义的字节范围概念。Since all HTTP entities are represented in HTTP messages as sequences of bytes, the concept of a byte range is meaningful for any HTTP entity. 但是，并非所有客户端和服务器必须支持字节范围操作。However, not all clients and servers need to support byte-range operations. 请求的范围标头允许客户端请求它仅想要接收的字节指定范围的某些部分中的 HTTP 实体。The Range header on a request allows a client to request that it only wants to receive some part of the specified range of bytes in an HTTP entity. 服务器不需要支持范围标头请求。Servers are not required to support Range header requests. `rangeSpecifier`参数将通常被指定为"bytes"，因为这是唯一的大多数 HTTP 服务器识别的范围说明符。The `rangeSpecifier` parameter would normally be specified as a "bytes", since this is the only range specifier recognized by most HTTP servers. 设置`rangeSpecifier`对某些其他字符串的参数可支持除字节数 （由 IETF RFC 2616 中定义的字节范围说明符） 以外的自定义范围说明符。Setting the `rangeSpecifier` parameter to some other string allows support for custom range specifiers other than bytes (the byte-range specifier defined in RFC 2616 by the IETF). 请求前 100 个字节会通过 HTTP 协议请求中的范围标头的示例应如下所示：An example of a Range header in an HTTP protocol request that requests the first 100 bytes would be would be the following: `Range: bytes=-99\r\n\r\n` 对于本例，请`rangeSpecifier`参数将被指定为"bytes"和`range`参数应为-99 之间。For this example, the `rangeSpecifier` parameter would be specified as "bytes" and the `range` parameter would be -99. HTTP 服务器指示支持的范围标头包含在响应中 Accept-ranges 标头。A HTTP server indicates support for Range headers with the Accept-Ranges header in the response. 支持字节范围的服务器的 Accept-ranges 标头的示例将如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that supports byte-ranges would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: bytes\r\n\r\n` Accept-ranges 标头未收到来自服务器的响应的标头中，如果服务器不支持范围标头。If an Accept-Ranges header is not received in the header of the response from the server, then the server does not support Range headers. 从服务器不支持范围，但可以识别 Accept-ranges 标头，Accept-ranges 标头的示例将如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that does not support ranges, but recognizes the Accept-Ranges header, would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: none\r\n\r\n` 从接收时响应范围请求，分析和可通过上的属性仅与整个请求相关联的 HTTP 标头类。When receiving the response from a range request, only the HTTP headers associated with the entire request are parsed and made available via properties on the class. 在响应中返回与每个范围关联的标题。Headers associated with each range are returned in the response.

HTTP 服务器指示支持的范围标头包含在响应中 Accept-ranges 标头。A HTTP server indicates support for Range headers with the Accept-Ranges header in the response. 支持字节范围的服务器的 Accept-ranges 标头的示例将如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that supports byte-ranges would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: bytes\r\n\r\n` Accept-ranges 标头中指定的字符串是将中通过指定范围说明符`rangeSpecifier`此方法的参数。The string specified in the Accept-Ranges header is the range-specifier that would be by specified in the `rangeSpecifier` parameter for this method. Accept-ranges 标头未收到来自服务器的响应的标头中，如果服务器不支持范围标头。If an Accept-Ranges header is not received in the header of the response from the server, then the server does not support Range headers. 从服务器不支持范围，但可以识别 Accept-ranges 标头，Accept-ranges 标头的示例将如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that does not support ranges, but recognizes the Accept-Ranges header, would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: none\r\n\r\n` 从接收时响应范围请求，分析和可通过上的属性仅与整个请求相关联的 HTTP 标头类。When receiving the response from a range request, only the HTTP headers associated with the entire request are parsed and made available via properties on the class. 在响应中返回与每个范围关联的标题。Headers associated with each range are returned in the response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 设置到`true`如果你想要到新位置的资源自动遵循 HTTP 重定向标头的请求。Set to `true` if you want the request to automatically follow HTTP redirection headers to the new location of the resource. 要遵循的重定向的最大数目设置属性。The maximum number of redirections to follow is set by the property. 如果设置为`false`，所有响应的 HTTP 状态代码从 300 到 399 都返回到应用程序。If is set to `false`, all responses with an HTTP status code from 300 to 399 is returned to the application. 在自动重定向清除授权标头和会自动尝试到重定向的位置重新进行身份验证。The Authorization header is cleared on auto-redirects and automatically tries to re-authenticate to the redirected location. 在实践中，这意味着，应用程序不能自定义身份验证将信息放到授权标头是否可能会遇到重定向。In practice, this means that an application can't put custom authentication information into the Authorization header if it is possible to encounter redirection. 相反，应用程序必须实现和注册自定义身份验证模块。Instead, the application must implement and register a custom authentication module. 和相关的类用于实现自定义身份验证模块。The and related class are used to implement a custom authentication module. 方法注册的自定义身份验证模块。The method registers a custom authentication module. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用属性，以允许跟随重定向响应的请求。The following code example uses the property to allow the request to follow redirection responses. [!code-cpp[HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect/CPP/httpwebrequest_allowautoredirect.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect/CS/httpwebrequest_allowautoredirect.cs#2)] [!code-vb[HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect/VB/httpwebrequest_allowautoredirect.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法启动用于将数据发送用于流的异步请求。The method starts an asynchronous request for a stream used to send data for the . 异步回调方法使用方法以返回实际的流。The asynchronous callback method uses the method to return the actual stream. 方法需要执行一些同步安装程序任务，此方法才会异步完成 （DNS 解析、 代理检测和 TCP 套接字连接，例如）。The method requires some synchronous setup tasks to complete (DNS resolution, proxy detection, and TCP socket connection, for example) before this method becomes asynchronous. 因此，调用此方法应永远不会在用户界面 (UI) 线程上因为这可能需要相当长的时间 （最多几分钟时间，具体取决于网络设置） 才能完成，将引发错误异常之前的初始同步设置任务或该方法成功。As a result, this method should never be called on a user interface (UI) thread because it might take considerable time (up to several minutes depending on network settings) to complete the initial synchronous setup tasks before an exception for an error is thrown or the method succeeds. 若要了解有关线程池的详细信息，请参阅[管理的线程池](~/docs/standard/threading/the-managed-thread-pool.md)。To learn more about the thread pool, see [The Managed Thread Pool](~/docs/standard/threading/the-managed-thread-pool.md). > [!NOTE] > 你的应用程序不能混合同步和异步方法对特定请求。Your application cannot mix synchronous and asynchronous methods for a particular request. 如果您调用方法，则必须使用方法以检索响应。If you call the method, you must use the method to retrieve the response. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用进行的流实例的异步请求的方法。The following code example uses the method to make an asynchronous request for a stream instance. [!code-cpp[HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream/CPP/httpwebrequest_begingetrequeststream.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream/CS/httpwebrequest_begingetrequeststream.cs#2)] [!code-vb[HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream/VB/httpwebrequest_begingetrequeststream.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序可以将证书添加到集合，但可能不具有访问权限。An application can add a certificate to a collection, but might not have access rights to it. 若要使用集合中包含的证书，则应用程序必须颁发证书的实体的相同访问权限。To use a certificate contained in the collection, the application must have the same access rights as the entity that issued the certificate. > [!NOTE] > 框架缓存 SSL 会话，因为它们创建并尝试再次使用的会话缓存适用于新的请求，在可能的情况。The Framework caches SSL sessions as they are created and attempts to reuse a cached session for a new request, if possible. 在尝试以重复使用的 SSL 会话时，框架将使用的第一个元素（如果没有一个），或尝试重复使用匿名会话，如果为空。When attempting to reuse an SSL session, the Framework uses the first element of (if there is one), or tries to reuse an anonymous sessions if is empty. > [!NOTE] > 出于性能原因，不应添加到客户端证书除非你知道该服务器将要求提供它。For performance reasons, you shouldn't add a client certificate to a unless you know the server will ask for it. > > 有关代码示例演示如何枚举在客户端证书存储中的证书，请参阅类。For a code example illustrating how to enumerate the certificates in the client certificate store, see the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性包含身份验证的信息来标识请求的创建者。The property contains authentication information to identify the maker of the request. 属性可以是，而在哪些情况下，用户、 密码和域中包含的信息对象用于进行身份验证请求，也可以是，在这种情况下统一资源请求的标识符 (URI) 用于确定要用于对请求进行身份验证用户、 密码和域信息。The property can be either a , in which case the user, password, and domain information contained in the object is used to authenticate the request, or it can be a , in which case the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the request is used to determine the user, password, and domain information to use to authenticate the request. 在大多数客户端方案中，应使用属性，其中包含当前登录用户的凭据。In most client scenarios, you should use the property, which contains the credentials of the currently logged on user. 若要执行此操作，设置属性设置为`true`而不是设置此属性。To do this, set the property to `true` instead of setting this property. 如果类用于在中间层应用程序，如 ASP.NET 应用程序中的凭据属性属于运行 ASP 页面 （服务器端的凭据） 的帐户。If the class is being used in a middle-tier application, such as an ASP.NET application, the credentials in the property belong to the account running the ASP page (the server-side credentials). 通常情况下，将此属性设置为客户端的名义发出请求的凭据。Typically, you would set this property to the credentials of the client on whose behalf the request is made. > [!NOTE] > 不能使用 NTLM 身份验证方案模拟其他用户。The NTLM authentication scheme cannot be used to impersonate another user. 必须专门配置 Kerberos 以支持使用模拟功能。Kerberos must be specially configured to support impersonation. 若要限制对一个或多个身份验证方法的 HttpWebRequest，使用类，并将你的凭据绑定到一个或多个身份验证方案To restrict HttpWebRequest to one or more authentication methods, use the class and bind your credentials to one or more authentication schemes 支持的身份验证方案包括摘要式、 协商、 Kerberos、 NTLM 和 Basic。Supported authentication schemes include Digest, Negotiate, Kerberos, NTLM, and Basic. 出于安全原因，操作时自动重定向，你想要包括在中的重定向将凭据存储并将其分配给此属性。For security reasons, when automatically following redirects, store the credentials that you want to be included in the redirect in a and assign it to this property. 此属性将自动设置为`null`在重定向，如果它包含所有非时。This property will automatically be set to `null` upon redirection if it contains anything except a . 具有此属性的值自动设置为`null`在这些情况下阻止凭据发送到任何非预期的目标。Having this property value be automatically set to `null` under those conditions prevents credentials from being sent to any unintended destination. ## Examples 下面的代码示例设置请求的凭据。The following code example sets the credentials for a request. [!code-cpp[NCLResponse1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLResponse1/CPP/httpwebrequest1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NCLResponse1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLResponse1/CS/httpwebrequest1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[NCLResponse1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLResponse1/VB/httpwebrequest1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 设置此属性注册为 HTTP 和 HTTPS 方案指定的策略。Setting this property registers the specified policy for the HTTP and HTTPS schemes. 如果此策略用于此请求：This policy is used for this request if: 没有任何为此请求指定的属性。There is no property specified for this request. \- 或 -\- or - 计算机和应用程序配置文件不会指定为统一资源标识符 (URI) 适用的缓存策略用于创建此请求。The machine and application configuration files do not specify a cache policy that is applicable to the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) used to create this request. 缓存策略确定是否可以从缓存而不是将请求发送给资源主机计算机执行所请求的资源。The cache policy determines whether the requested resource can be taken from a cache instead of sending the request to the resource host computer. 如果资源的响应流是检索并读取到流的末尾时，资源的副本才会添加到缓存。A copy of a resource is only added to the cache if the response stream for the resource is retrieved and read to the end of the stream. 嗯，另一请求相同的资源可以使用缓存的副本，具体取决于此请求的缓存策略级别。So another request for the same resource could use a cached copy, depending on the cache policy level for this request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将返回对象，其中包含来自 Internet 资源的响应。The method returns a object that contains the response from the Internet resource. 返回的实际实例，并可以类型转换为该类的访问特定于 HTTP 的属性。The actual instance returned is an , and can be typecast to that class to access HTTP-specific properties. 一个上设置的属性时，某些情况下将引发类是冲突。A is thrown in several cases when the properties set on the class are conflicting. 如果应用程序设置，会发生此异常属性和属性设置为`true`，然后将发送 HTTP GET 请求。This exception occurs if an application sets the property and the property to `true`, and then sends an HTTP GET request. 如果应用程序尝试向发送分块请求仅支持 HTTP 1.0 协议的服务器不支持此操作，会发生此异常。This exception occurs if an application tries to send chunked to a server that only supports HTTP 1.0 protocol, where this is not supported. 如果应用程序尝试发送数据，而设置不会发生此异常属性或是`false`禁用缓冲，并且 keepalive 连接上 (属性是`true`)`.`This exception occurs if an application tries to send data without setting the property or the is `false` when buffering is disabled and on a keepalive connection (the property is `true`)`.` > [!CAUTION] > 必须调用方法来关闭流并释放该连接。You must call the method to close the stream and release the connection. 如果不这样做可能会导致应用程序运行完连接。Failure to do so may cause your application to run out of connections. 使用 POST 方法时，必须获取请求流、 写入数据发布，并关闭流。When using the POST method, you must get the request stream, write the data to be posted, and close the stream. 此方法阻止等待内容发布;如果没有超时设置，并且不提供无限期地调用的线程阻止的内容。This method blocks waiting for content to post; if there is no time-out set and you do not provide content, the calling thread blocks indefinitely. > [!NOTE] > 多次调用返回相同的响应对象中; 请求不重新颁发。Multiple calls to return the same response object; the request is not reissued. > [!NOTE] > 你的应用程序不能混合同步和异步方法对特定请求。Your application cannot mix synchronous and asynchronous methods for a particular request. 如果您调用方法，则必须使用方法以检索响应。If you call the method, you must use the method to retrieve the response. > [!NOTE] > 如果是引发，使用和异常来确定来自服务器的响应的属性。If a is thrown, use the and properties of the exception to determine the response from the server. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). > [!NOTE] > 出于安全原因，默认情况下禁用了 cookie。For security reasons, cookies are disabled by default. 如果想要使用 cookie，则使用属性，以便启用 cookie。If you wish to use cookies, use the property to enable cookies. ## Examples 下面的代码示例获取请求的响应。The following code example gets the response for a request. [!code-cpp[NCLResponse1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLResponse1/CPP/httpwebrequest1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NCLResponse1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLResponse1/CS/httpwebrequest1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[NCLResponse1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLResponse1/VB/httpwebrequest1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 集合包含与请求关联的协议标头。The collection contains the protocol headers associated with the request. 下表列出了不会存储在 HTTP 标头集合而是由系统设置或设置由属性或方法。The following table lists the HTTP headers that are not stored in the collection but are either set by the system or set by properties or methods. |HeaderHeader|通过设置Set by| |------------|------------| |接受Accept|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |连接Connection|通过设置属性和属性。Set by the property and property.| |内容长度Content-Length|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |Content-TypeContent-Type|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |期望Expect|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |日期Date|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |HostHost|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |如果-修改-自If-Modified-Since|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |范围Range|通过设置方法。Set by the method.| |引用站点Referer|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| |传输编码Transfer-Encoding|通过设置属性 (属性必须为 true)。Set by the property (the property must be true).| |用户代理User-Agent|通过设置属性。Set by the property.| 方法会抛出如果尝试设置这些受保护的标头之一。The method throws an if you try to set one of these protected headers. 更改属性已通过调用已启动的请求后， ， ，或方法，则会引发。Changing the property after the request has been started by calling , , , or method throws an . 不应假定，标头值将保持不变，，因为 Web 服务器和缓存可能会更改或向 Web 请求添加标头。You should not assume that the header values will remain unchanged, because Web servers and caches may change or add headers to a Web request. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用属性打印到控制台的 HTTP 标头名称/值对。The following code example uses the property to print the HTTP header name/value pairs to the console. remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性可以用于将主机设置独立于请求 URI 的 HTTP 请求中要使用的标头值。The property can be used to set the Host header value to use in an HTTP request independent from the request URI. 属性可以包含主机名和一个可选的端口号。The property can consist of a hostname and an optional port number. 主机标头不带端口信息意味着服务请求 （端口 80 用于 HTTP URL，例如） 的默认端口。A Host header without port information implies the default port for the service requested (port 80 for an HTTP URL, for example). 指定主机和端口的格式必须遵循 14.23 小节中的 RFC2616 IETF 发布的规则。The format for specifying a host and port must follow the rules in section 14.23 of RFC2616 published by the IETF. 示例演示如何满足这些要求指定端口 8080 是以下值以查找属性：An example complying with these requirements that specifies a port of 8080 would be the following value for the property: `www.contoso.com:8080` 使用属性来显式指定自定义的主机标头值还会影响缓存的区域、 cookie 和身份验证。Using the property to explicitly specify a custom Host header value also affects areas caching, cookies, and authentication. 当应用程序提供了有关特定的 URI 前缀的凭据时，该应用程序将需要确保使用包含的值的主机标头，不是在 URI 中的目标服务器的 URI。When an application provides credentials for a specific URI prefix, the applications needs to make sure to use the URI containing the value of the Host header, not the target server in the URI. 使用缓存资源时的密钥使用主机标头值而不是请求 URI。The key used when caching resources, uses the Host header value rather than the request URI. Cookie 存储在和服务器的域名以逻辑方式分组。Cookies are stored in a and logically grouped by the server domain name. 如果应用程序指定主机标头，此值将用作域。If the application specifies a Host header, then this value will be used as domain. 如果属性未设置，则要在 HTTP 请求中使用的主机标头值基于在请求 URI 上。If the property is not set, then the Host header value to use in an HTTP request is based on the request URI.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对特定的客户端请求后成功进行身份验证，如果是`true`并在提供凭据，在 Authorization 标头与每个请求发送到任何相匹配的特定直到最后一个正斜杠。After a client request to a specific is successfully authenticated, if is `true` and credentials are supplied, the Authorization header is sent with each request to any that matches the specific up to the last forward slash. 因此，如果客户端请求已成功通过特定包含如下内容：So if the client request successfully authenticated to a specific that contains the following: `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath/` 然后进行预身份验证的授权标头与每个请求发送到以下任一实例：Then the Authorization header for preauthentication is sent with each request to any of the following instances: `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath/` `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath/default` `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath/default.html` `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath/sample.html` 但是，在 Authorization 标头是未随请求一起发送到以下任一实例：However, the Authorization header is not sent with requests to any of the following instances: `http://www.contoso.com/` `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath` `http://www.contoso.com/secondpath/` 如果客户端请求到特定是不成功进行身份验证，请求使用标准身份验证过程。If the client request to a specific is not successfully authenticated, the request uses standard authentication procedures. 第一个请求，除了属性指示是否将发送到的后续请求使用的身份验证信息相匹配的特定于直到而无需等待最后一个正斜杠服务器的质询。With the exception of the first request, the property indicates whether to send authentication information with subsequent requests to a that matches the specific up to the last forward slash without waiting to be challenged by the server. 客户端和服务器之间的以下对话框说明了此属性的效果。The following dialog between client and server illustrates the effect of this property. 该对话框假设基本身份验证正在使用中。The dialog assumes that basic authentication is in use. 是`false`: is `false`: 客户端： GET someUrlClient: GET someUrl 服务器： 401 Www-authenticate 的 BasicServer: 401 WWW-Authenticate Basic 使用授权标头获取客户端：Client: GET with Authorization headers 服务器： 200 确定Server: 200 OK 客户端： GET someUrlClient: GET someUrl 服务器： 401 Www-authenticate 的 BasicServer: 401 WWW-Authenticate Basic 使用授权标头获取客户端：Client: GET with Authorization headers 服务器： 200 确定Server: 200 OK 是`true`: is `true`: 客户端： GET someUrlClient: GET someUrl 服务器： 401 Www-authenticate 的 BasicServer: 401 WWW-Authenticate Basic 使用授权标头获取客户端：Client: GET with Authorization headers 服务器： 200 确定Server: 200 OK 客户端： 获取 someUrl 与授权标头Client: GET someUrl with Authorization headers 如果身份验证方案不支持预身份验证，则忽略此属性的值。If the authentication scheme does not support preauthentication, the value of this property is ignored.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性标识对象，用于处理对 Internet 资源的请求。The property identifies the object to use to process requests to Internet resources. 若要指定应使用任何代理，请设置属性设置为返回的代理实例方法。To specify that no proxy should be used, set the property to the proxy instance returned by the method. 在本地计算机或应用程序配置文件可以指定使用默认代理。The local computer or application config file may specify that a default proxy be used. 如果指定属性，然后从的代理设置属性重写在本地计算机或应用程序配置文件和实例将使用指定的代理设置。If the property is specified, then the proxy settings from the property override the local computer or application config file and the instance will use the proxy settings specified. 如果未指定代理配置文件中，属性未指定，类使用继承自 Internet 资源管理器在本地计算机上的代理设置。If no proxy is specified in a config file and the property is unspecified, the class uses the proxy settings inherited from Internet Explorer on the local computer. 如果没有在 Internet Explorer 代理设置，该请求是直接发送到服务器。If there are no proxy settings in Internet Explorer, the request is sent directly to the server. 类分析包含通配符字符的代理跳过列表继承从 Internet 资源管理器相同直接通过 Internet Explorer 分析时跳过列表。The class parses a proxy bypass list with wildcard characters inherited from Internet Explorer the same as the bypass list is parsed directly by Internet Explorer. 例如，类将正则表达式的分析的"nt *"从 Internet 资源管理器的跳过列表"nt。\*"。For example, the class will parse a bypass list of "nt*" from Internet Explorer as a regular expression of "nt.\*". 因此的 URL"`http://nt.com`"将绕过代理帐户使用类并使用 Internet Explorer。So a URL of "`http://nt.com`" would bypass the proxy using the class and using Internet Explorer. 类支持绕过本地代理。The class supports local proxy bypass. 类会视为目标为本地如果满足以下条件之一：The class considers a destination to be local if any of the following conditions are met: - 目标包含平面名称 （在 URL 中没有句点）。The destination contains a flat name (no dots in the URL). - 目标包含与环回地址 (或) 或目标包含分配给本地计算机。The destination contains a loopback address ( or ) or the destination contains an assigned to the local computer. - 目标的域后缀匹配本地计算机的域后缀 ()。The domain suffix of the destination matches the local computer's domain suffix (). 更改属性已通过调用已启动的请求后， ， ，或方法，则会引发。Changing the property after the request has been started by calling the , , , or method throws an . 有关代理元素的信息，请参阅[ \&l t; defaultProxy\&g t;元素 （网络设置）](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/network/defaultproxy-element-network-settings.md)。For information on the proxy element see [\<defaultProxy\> Element (Network Settings)](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/network/defaultproxy-element-network-settings.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用方法以获取请求的代理信息。The following code example uses the method to get the proxy information for the request. remarks.format: ## Remarks 是与发出后续的同步请求的毫秒数方法等待响应，和方法等待流。 is the number of milliseconds that a subsequent synchronous request made with the method waits for a response, and the method waits for a stream. 适用于整个请求和响应，不单独对和方法调用。The applies to the entire request and response, not individually to the and method calls. 如果在超时期间内未返回该资源，请求将引发与属性设置为。If the resource is not returned within the time-out period, the request throws a with the property set to . 属性必须设置之前或调用方法。The property must be set before the or method is called. 更改属性后调用或方法不起作用Changing the property after calling the or method has no effect 属性具有与发出异步请求不会影响或方法。The property has no effect on asynchronous requests made with the or method. > [!CAUTION] > 对于异步请求，客户端应用程序实现其自己的超时机制。In the case of asynchronous requests, the client application implements its own time-out mechanism. 中的示例，请参阅方法。Refer to the example in the method. 若要指定的时间来等待读取或写入操作超时，请使用属性。To specify the amount of time to wait before a read or write operation times out, use the property. 域名系统 (DNS) 查询可能需要最多 15 秒钟才能返回或超时时间。如果你的请求包含需要解析的主机名，并设置的值不超过 15 秒，可能需要花费 15 秒或更长时间才引发来指示你的请求超时。A Domain Name System (DNS) query may take up to 15 seconds to return or time out. If your request contains a host name that requires resolution and you set to a value less than 15 seconds, it may take 15 seconds or more before a is thrown to indicate a timeout on your request. ## Examples 下面的代码示例设置属性的对象。The following code example sets the property of the object. span.span: to keep the authenticated connection open; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性的默认值是`false`，这将导致当前连接的请求完成后关闭。The default value for this property is `false`, which causes the current connection to be closed after a request is completed. 每次它会发出新请求时，你的应用程序必须经过身份验证序列。Your application must go through the authentication sequence every time it issues a new request. 如果此属性设置为`true`，用于检索响应的连接保持打开状态后执行身份验证。If this property is set to `true`, the connection used to retrieve the response remains open after the authentication has been performed. 在这种情况下，其他请求具有此属性设置为`true`可以使用该连接而无需重新进行身份验证。In this case, other requests that have this property set to `true` may use the connection without re-authenticating. 换而言之，如果一个连接已经过身份验证的用户 A，用户 B 可能重复使用 A 的连接;根据用户 A.的凭据实现用户 B 的请求In other words, if a connection has been authenticated for user A, user B may reuse A's connection; user B's request is fulfilled based on the credentials of user A. > [!CAUTION] > 因为它是应用程序可以使用而无需进行身份验证的连接，您需要确保没有任何管理漏洞在你的系统时此属性设置为`true`。Because it is possible for an application to use the connection without being authenticated, you need to be sure that there is no administrative vulnerability in your system when setting this property to `true`. 如果你的应用程序将请求发送多个用户 （模拟多个用户帐户） 和依赖于身份验证来保护资源，未设置此属性`true`除非你使用连接组，如下所述。If your application sends requests for multiple users (impersonates multiple user accounts) and relies on authentication to protect resources, do not set this property to `true` unless you use connection groups as described below. 可能需要考虑启用此机制，如果您有性能问题和集成 Windows 身份验证的 Web 服务器上运行你的应用程序。You may want to consider enabling this mechanism if your are having performance problems and your application is running on a Web server with integrated Windows authentication. 启用此设置将使系统面临安全风险。Enabling this setting opens the system to security risks. 如果您设置属性设置为`true`确保采取以下预防措施：If you set the property to `true` be sure to take the following precautions: - 使用属性来管理不同的用户的连接。Use the property to manage connections for different users. 这将避免连接的使用可能由未经身份验证应用程序。This avoids the potential use of the connection by non-authenticated applications. 例如，用户 A 应具有唯一的连接组名称不同于用户 b。这提供了一层隔离每个用户帐户。For example, user A should have a unique connection group name that is different from user B. This provides a layer of isolation for each user account. - 为了帮助避免连接被利用的受保护环境中运行应用程序。Run your application in a protected environment to help avoid possible connection exploits. 如果您控制后端服务器，也可以考虑关闭身份验证持久性。If you control the back-end server, as an alternative you might consider turning off authentication persistence. 这将提高性能一定程度上，但更安全。This increases performance to a lesser degree, but it is safer. 有关更多详细信息，搜索上的 MSDN library 中的 AuthPersistence [ http://msdn.microsoft.com/library ](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library)。For more details, search for AuthPersistence in the MSDN library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library). > [!NOTE] > 如果这两个并设置为`true`，每个请求发送来自不安全的池，但具有一个授权标头使用的连接。If both and are set to `true`, each request is sent using a connection from the unsafe pool, but with an Authorization header.
